title: What are the most iconic and recognizable K-pop outfits? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m doing both hairstyles and outfits, because yes there are some hairstyles that were very iconic. But also, some of these were outfits that are currently labeled as cringey in this day and age, based on the question What were the cringiest k-pop outfits? So you may see an overlap. Mostly this answer contains mainly 2nd generation outfits, since the 3rd generation-4th generation isn’t quite over yet (I also can’t remember many outfits in the 3rd generation that are iconic or recognizable, it usually depends on if the song or mv itself are iconic too, at least for me.) But here are some, that I thought were iconic or recognizable: 2ne1’s Dara during their Fire promotions with her iconic hair.  SNSD during their Genie promotions  Kara in Mr. promotions  H.O.T Candy outfits. (Many idols have covered this song with these exact outfits).  G-dragon’s hair in Fantastic Baby is very iconic  Not to mention, Big Bang’s Fantastic Baby outfits were very recognizable, lots dressed up as them for events and such.  Red Velvet’s Dumb Dumb outfits  After School Bang outfits  T-ara’s paws and ears, during Bo Peep Bo Peep promotions  Crayon Pop’s Bar Bar Bar outfits  Outfits I feel that will be iconic in the future, or maybe they are, I’m not sure: Twice’s Heart Shaker outfits  BTS’s Dope outfits  Even though this is a common outfit among western singers, but particularly for kpop fans, I feel that Hwasa’s outfit during MAMA 2018 will be an iconic and recognizable outfit. Since it sparked such controversy.  Lastly, how could we ever forget about you JYP?

I’m going to list the most iconic and recognisable outfits for me lately :) This was one of the most iconic outfit for me this year ; the dress is quite short but it looks amazing anyways 2. The red dress was a whole look ; not to mention the makeup  3. One of my favourite Miyeon outfits  4. Overall a simple outfit but very recognisable for me  5. nothing to say besides ICONIC  6. Hard to forget  7. I was shook when I saw this one  *feel free to disagree, this was just my opinion*
